meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: The successful launch of the AI16Z to elizaOS token migration portal represents a critical milestone in platform evolution while Jin's breakthrough with headless Chrome streaming technology establishes a technical foundation for the 24/7 agent activity showcases required by our monthly directive.

key_points.summary: The AI16Z to elizaOS token migration launched successfully after some initial LP provider delays, with a 1:6 conversion ratio and 90-day window ending February 4th, 2024, demonstrating smooth implementation but revealing some exchange integration and documentation challenges.

deliberation_items.text: What is our priority action to ensure the token migration proceeds with minimal community friction?
context: Shaw confirmed unclaimed tokens won't be burned after the deadline; users can create support tickets
Users reported smooth migration experiences through the portal
Some exchanges are still implementing the swap, causing temporary token disappearance from exchange wallets

answer_1.text: Accelerate remaining exchange integrations by dedicating additional technical resources.
answer_1.implication: Prioritizing exchange integration would minimize user frustration but divert resources from development goals.

answer_2.text: Create comprehensive migration documentation with step-by-step instructions and screenshots.
answer_2.implication: Better documentation would empower self-service migration but doesn't address underlying technical integration issues.

answer_3.text: Establish a dedicated migration support channel with 24/7 coverage during the 90-day window.
answer_3.implication: A dedicated support channel would improve user experience but requires significant operational resources.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we leverage the token migration to drive development of auto.fun, given its importance in our monthly goal?
context: Migration was delayed initially due to issues with the LP provider on Base, but eventually launched successfully

answer_1.text: Implement migration statistics tracking on auto.fun to gamify participation and drive platform engagement.
answer_1.implication: Gamification could drive user engagement with auto.fun but adds complexity to the migration process.

answer_2.text: Fast-track staking functionality to incentivize holders to migrate and lock elizaOS tokens.
answer_2.implication: Staking would provide immediate utility for the new token but could divert resources from core auto.fun development.

answer_3.text: Launch a promotional 'migrator bonus' on auto.fun that rewards early migrators with exclusive agent capabilities.
answer_3.implication: Migration incentives tied to auto.fun would boost both processes but create expectations for continued rewards.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What approach should we take regarding unclaimed tokens after the February 4th deadline?
context: Shaw confirmed unclaimed tokens won't be burned after the deadline; users can create support tickets
Migration portal launched on November 6th with a 90-day window ending February 4th, 2024

answer_1.text: Maintain indefinite support for migration through manual support tickets.
answer_1.implication: Indefinite support maximizes user satisfaction but creates ongoing operational overhead.

answer_2.text: Implement a 30-day grace period after which unclaimed tokens contribute to DAO treasury.
answer_2.implication: A defined grace period provides clarity while eventually recapturing value for the ecosystem.

answer_3.text: Extend migration window by 60 days but communicate a firm final deadline with clear consequences.
answer_3.implication: Extending with a firm deadline balances user accommodation with operational certainty.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Jin's implementation of headless Chrome with GPU support enables reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3D simulations with live chat integration, directly supporting our monthly goal of showcasing agent activity to attract users to auto.fun.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize the deployment of this streaming technology across our ecosystem?
context: Jin implemented headless Chrome with GPU support to stream WebGL applications to RTMP endpoints
The containerized approach enables reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3D simulations with live chat integration
Plans to support multiple avatars and shows in the interactive streaming setup

answer_1.text: Focus on high-visibility trading agent streams first to showcase practical utility.
answer_1.implication: Prioritizing trading agents demonstrates practical value but may be less visually engaging.

answer_2.text: Deploy generalist entertainment streams with multiple agents interacting to maximize audience appeal.
answer_2.implication: Entertainment-focused streams could attract more users but might not demonstrate practical utility.

answer_3.text: Create specialized themed streams for different verticals (trading, creative, gaming) with dedicated agent personas.
answer_3.implication: Diversified streams demonstrate breadth of capability but require more production resources.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: Should we make this containerized streaming capability a core elizaCloud feature or keep it as a specialized solution?
context: Consider making containerized streaming an Eliza cloud feature (Mentioned by jin)
The containerized approach enables reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3D simulations with live chat integration

answer_1.text: Integrate as a core elizaCloud feature with standardized APIs and documentation.
answer_1.implication: Core integration supports ecosystem growth but creates ongoing maintenance obligations.

answer_2.text: Maintain as specialized solution for auto.fun exclusively to differentiate the platform.
answer_2.implication: Auto.fun exclusivity creates platform differentiation but limits broader ecosystem adoption.

answer_3.text: Develop as a premium add-on service with tiered access based on computational requirements.
answer_3.implication: A premium service model generates revenue but could slow adoption and community contributions.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Negotiations for recovery of X accounts through a backdated enterprise license and discussions with Coinbase about a potential listing represent significant business developments that could expand platform reach and token liquidity.

deliberation_items.text: How should we balance resources between the X account recovery effort and Coinbase listing discussions?
context: Deal nearly finalized with X to recover accounts through a backdated enterprise license (expected in 1-2 weeks)
Positive discussions with Coinbase about a potential listing, facilitated by a connection named Gaia

answer_1.text: Prioritize X account recovery as it directly impacts our ability to showcase agents and reach users.
answer_1.implication: Focusing on X recovery improves short-term marketing reach but delays potential liquidity improvements.

answer_2.text: Prioritize Coinbase listing discussions as expanded token availability is foundational to ecosystem growth.
answer_2.implication: Prioritizing exchange listing improves liquidity and reach but doesn't address immediate marketing capabilities.

answer_3.text: Pursue both efforts equally while establishing clear success metrics and resource limits for each.
answer_3.implication: Balanced approach maintains momentum on both fronts but may extend timelines for both outcomes.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What is the most strategic approach to leverage the potential Coinbase listing for advancing our monthly goal?
context: Positive discussions with Coinbase about a potential listing, facilitated by a connection named Gaia
Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity

answer_1.text: Develop Coinbase-specific onboarding that directs new token holders to auto.fun with incentives.
answer_1.implication: Directed onboarding could efficiently convert token buyers to platform users but creates additional development requirements.

answer_2.text: Time agent showcase launches to coincide with listing announcement to maximize attention and traffic.
answer_2.implication: Coordinated timing maximizes impact but creates interdependencies between technical and business milestones.

answer_3.text: Focus on getting listed first without coupling to product initiatives to avoid delays in either process.
answer_3.implication: Decoupling processes ensures faster listing but misses potential synergy between token availability and platform adoption.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
